page.title: 06ACTIVITIES AT LOWER HARDRES
page.content: {The Women's Institute,}a National organisation has over 400000 members. Its purpose is to endeavour to improve the quality of life in rural areas and to provide educational and leisure activities. At Lower Hardres Hall monthly meetings include Business Matters, a Speaker and social time. {Street End Cricket Club}formed in 1981 now has only 3 local players. The Ground with a pavilion, at Street End Place has the unusual feature of a tree within the boundary. Most matches played at weekends, are "Friendlies". The club holds an annual Dinner and various fund-raising events.{Kent {County Council's Moblie Library}visits the area once a week. The 19th century {Granville Inn}provides bar snacks a restaurant open in the evenings and traditional Sunday Lunch.
